page.title: 19Local issues, Abermorddu
page.content: {Open-cast Mining:}In the late 1950's came the first proposals to mine on land off Plas Maen Drive, Cefnybedd. Had this proceeded it would have used the land on which the private housing estate opposite Abermorddu Primary School now stands and would have extended to the boundaries of the present school. In the early 1980's a modified application was submitted and this has been strongly opposed by local residents. Their spokeman, Mr.Michael Barber is optimistic that the proposed development will not take place. {Village By-pass:}Abermorddu would lose the heavy volume of traffic it now bears should the Caergwrle by-pass be built. However, opinion is divided over the route the by-pass should follow and until this is settled villagers will have to wait.
